title: Difference between eXp Sponsor and Real Estate Team
excerpt: Key takeaway: In the eXp sponsor team vs real estate team comparison, sponsor teams tie you to your 7-level upline for training, tools, and revenue…
content:
Key takeaway: In the eXp sponsor team vs real estate team comparison, sponsor teams tie you to your 7-level upline for training, tools, and revenue share. Production teams work together to close deals and split commissions. You can be in both, but only a sponsor team impacts your long-term passive income potential.

TL;DR About eXp Sponsor Team vs Real Estate Team

  • Sponsor team = value + support tied to naming a sponsor
  • Production team = shared deals and commissions
  • You can be in both at eXp Realty
  • Only sponsor teams unlock 7-tier upline resources
  • Smart Agent Alliance offers both marketing and sponsor team benefits

eXp Sponsor Team vs Real Estate (Production) Team

You might think “team” means the same thing everywhere. Not at eXp Realty. Here, you’ll hear sponsor team and production team used like they’re interchangeable, but they’re not even in the same weight class. 

A sponsor team can be your behind-the-scenes growth engine, motivating you to up your game and your revenue share income. A production team is your boots-on-the-ground deal squad, hustling contracts and closings. Some agents join both. Others find one is plenty. 

Both can grow your business, but in totally different ways. The wrong choice in your sponsor team? That’s like signing a cell phone contract with no data plan. You’ll realize what’s missing only after you need it.

eXp Sponsor Team vs Real Estate (Production) Team
What Does a Sponsor Team Do at eXp Realty?
What Does a Real Estate Production Team Focus On?
Can You Join Both a Sponsor and Production Team?
Can Your Production Team Leader Be Your Sponsor or Co-Sponsor?
How to Evaluate the Right Support System for Your Goals
Can You Change Your Primary Sponsor or Production Team After Joining?
Why This Topic Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

What Does a Sponsor Team Do at eXp Realty?

A sponsor team can plug you into your upline for mentorship, training, and tools to scale both production and revenue share.

Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack take this beyond theory. We deliver maximum training, community and passive income support to help you stay motivated, trained with top current strategies, and able to keep a reasonable work/life balance

Real-world example: A Wolf Pack agent in a small coastal market tripled GCI in 12 months using our YouTube + Facebook group strategy without buying a single lead. That’s sponsor team value you can’t replicate with just a production team.

What Does a Real Estate Production Team Focus On?

In short: Production teams are unique and work differently.  However, most are local and most work deals together with shared leads, deal segmentation, or marketing costs.  All take a piece of your commission in exchange for support.

You might get access to the team’s CRM, pooled advertising, and transaction support. This boosts short-term income but stops when the closings stop.

Think of it as “eat what you kill”—great for cash flow, but there’s no residual income. That’s why many top producers at eXp run with both: they use production teams for deal volume and sponsor teams for scalable, passive income.

Can You Join Both a Sponsor and Production Team?

Absolutely, and if you play it right, you’ll get the best of both worlds.

Your sponsor team is locked in the moment you name them on your eXp application, but that doesn’t block you from joining a production team. In fact, plenty of Smart Agent Alliance rookies double up. They tap us for the high-level stuff like AI systems, funnels, top-producer masterminds, and a 7-level upline invested in their success.  They lean on a local production team for boots-on-the-ground deal flow and daily support.

Think of it like running two income engines: your production team pays you today, and your sponsor team builds the residual checks you’ll thank yourself for later.

Can Your Production Team Leader Be Your Sponsor or Co-Sponsor?

Yes, but that doesn’t make it a smart move. Production team leaders are focused on keeping deals moving, not building the kind of scalable value powerhouse sponsor teams provide. If you leave the production team, you also leave any sponsor benefits tied to them.

The better play? Pick a proven sponsor team and join whatever production team fits your style. If your production team leader insists on a sponsor role, make them the co-sponsor. That way, if you ever leave the team and their value disappears, you can petition eXp to change your co-sponsor. It’s not guaranteed, but at least you’ve got an exit ramp.

How to Evaluate the Right Support System for Your Goals

Here’s the answer: Start with your goals, then pick the setup that actually delivers.

  • If you want mentorship and scalable income, grill sponsor teams on their resources.
  • If you need closings now, dig into a production team’s lead flow.
  • If you want both, make sure the production team isn’t allergic to outside affiliations.

Ask direct, can’t-dodge questions:

  • “What specific value does your upline provide?”
  • “What’s your agent retention rate?”
  • “Do you have testimonials from your agents?”

At Smart Agent Alliance, the answers aren’t vague promises, they’re case studies from agents who’ve doubled or tripled production. You’ll get every tool we build, every system we refine, and every mastermind we host. And here’s the kicker: we don’t take a commission split, and we don’t nickel-and-dime you with upsells like some sponsor teams. You get it all. Free. Period.

Can You Change Your Primary Sponsor or Production Team After Joining?

Once you name your primary sponsor in your eXp application and go active, it’s locked. The only way to change is to leave for 12 months, forfeit any unvested stock, and rejoin under a new sponsor. That’s why vetting your sponsor before joining isn’t optional, it’s survival. One small out: if you mis-enter your sponsor but aren’t yet active, eXp support might fix it.

Changing your real estate production team? That’s a whole different game. It depends on your team agreement. Meet those terms and you’re free to go solo, join a new production team, or start your own. Production teams can swap players without ever touching your upline.

Your sponsor team plugs you into your 7-level upline, with potential access to training, masterminds, marketing systems, and, in Smart Agent Alliance’s case, a ready-made agent attraction engine. Pick the wrong sponsor and you don’t just lose a teammate, you lose the backbone that could’ve scaled your business and revenue share for years.

Example: We’ve onboarded agents from “silent sponsors” who said switching to us was like going from dial-up to fiber. The only downside? Waiting 12 months to make it happen.

Why This Topic Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Your sponsor choice is locked at onboarding. That decision determines your upline, revenue share potential, and whether you’re getting tools that keep working after the deal closes. Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack give you:

Dual Sponsorship Power

  • Built-in support from two powerful teams at eXp: Smart Agent Alliance (SAA) + the Wolf Pack
  • Zero team splits or added costs. You get just the full value of both teams, free with SAA sponsorship
  • Plug into a system that’s already built to scale your production and passive income — just start driving.

Top Real Estate Coaching:

  • Weekly zoom calls with world-class training 
  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($997/yr savings)
  • AI Agent Accelerator ($997 savings)
  • Real Estate Investing ($497 savings)
  • Fast Track Agent Business Plan

Marketing Assets

  • 8 landing pages with email automation
  • 100s of beautiful ready-made marketing templates

Plug & Play Systems so you gain passive income:

  • Personal agent attraction page – created & hosted ($1164/yr savings)
  • Automated email campaign so you stay top of mind
  • Webinars done for your prospective agents
  • 1on 1 calls with leaders done for your prospective agents
  • Fast Track Passive Income Plan

Inspiring Community:

  • Weekly calls to connect with team members
  • Private referral WhatsApp groups 
  • Full access to our national and international agent network

Curious how this stacks up to what you’re currently getting (or not getting)? Check out our eXp Commission and Fees Calculator. Interested in passive income opportunities? Run the numbers yourself with our Revenue Share Calculator. Learn more about all the details that make up eXp realty or Smart Agent Alliance. Learn everything about eXp sponsorship.

Choose right now, and you won’t have to start over later.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I be part of both a sponsor team and a production team?

Yes. At eXp, your sponsor team is fixed when you onboard, but you can join a production team anytime. Many Smart Agent Alliance agents are part of both: a sponsor team for scalable value, systems, and revenue share, plus a production team for boots-on-the-ground deal flow. This combo lets you earn now and build passive income for later.

What does a sponsor team do that a production team doesn’t?

Sponsor teams connect you to your 7-level upline, provide marketing systems, coaching, and passive income pathways through revenue share. Production teams focus on closing deals together for shared commissions.

Does your sponsor control your business at eXp Realty?

No. Your sponsor can offer tools, training, and support, but you still run your own business, choose your marketing, and keep your brand identity. The right sponsor team amplifies your business without dictating it.

Should your team leader be your sponsor too?

Production team leaders are focused on transactions, not long-term sponsor value. If they insist on being named, make them your co-sponsor instead. That way if you leave their team, you’re not stuck losing both your production group and your sponsor benefits.

Do I need a team if I already have a sponsor line?

Not necessarily. A high-value sponsor team like Smart Agent Alliance can give you training, lead gen, masterminds, and attraction systems without taking a production split. Many agents use sponsor teams as their full business backbone and skip production teams entirely.

Can you change your primary sponsor or production team after joining?

Your primary sponsor is locked once you go active at eXp. The only way to change is to leave for 12 months, forfeit unvested stock, and rejoin under a new sponsor. Production teams are different. You can leave or switch based on your team agreement, without affecting your upline.

title: Can I Change My Sponsor at eXp Realty?
excerpt: Key takeaway: You cannot change your primary sponsor at eXp Realty after activation. The only way is to leave for 12 months, forfeit any unvested…
content:
Key takeaway: You cannot change your primary sponsor at eXp Realty after activation. The only way is to leave for 12 months, forfeit any unvested stock, and rejoin under a new sponsor. Co-sponsors can sometimes be changed with eXp’s approval, giving you secondary support flexibility without altering your main upline.

TL;DR About Changing Your Sponsor at eXp Realty

  • Primary sponsor locked after activation
  • Only change by leaving for 12 months
  • Co-sponsor changes may be approved by eXp
  • Leaving resets downline and revenue share tiers
  • Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack offer full support

Changing your sponsor at eXp Realty isn’t like swapping desks in a brick-and-mortar office, it’s more like getting a new business partner. Your primary sponsor is locked once you go active, shaping your access to upline training, masterminds, and revenue share potential. Pick wrong and you’re stuck for 12 months, losing any unvested stock and starting from scratch when you rejoin. 

Co-sponsors give you more flexibility, but they’re not a substitute for the right main sponsor from day one. Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack agents plug into proven systems, marketing assets, and a community that actually shows up.

Can You Change Your Primary Sponsor After Joining?

The bottom line: Once you name your primary sponsor in your eXp application and go active, it’s locked. The only way to change is to leave for 12 months, forfeit any unvested stock, and rejoin under a new sponsor. That’s why vetting your sponsor before joining isn’t optional, it’s survival. One small out: if you mis-enter your sponsor but aren’t yet active, eXp support might fix it.

Your sponsor team plugs you into your 7-level upline, with potential access to training, masterminds, marketing systems, and, in Smart Agent Alliance’s case, a ready-made agent attraction engine. Pick the wrong sponsor, and you lose the backbone that could’ve scaled your business and revenue share for years.

Example: We’ve onboarded agents from “silent sponsors” who said switching to us was like going from dial-up to fiber. The only downside? Waiting 12 months to make it happen.

What Happens if You Leave and Return to eXp? 

The bottom line: Leaving eXp wipes your sponsor relationship, unvested stock, and revenue share downline. Rejoining gives you a clean slate. You can choose a new primary sponsor and even name a new co-sponsor, but every revenue share tier resets and you start from zero.

If you leave eXp and come back wanting to join the same upline you had before, you can petition eXp to allow it, but there are no guarantees. If you’re leaving to fix a sponsor mismatch, trade up, not sideways. Pick a line that brings real systems, fast onboarding, and leaders who actually show up. Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack deliver marketing horsepower, done-for-you attraction, and sticky retention, so when you’re-up, you’re building on bedrock, not sand.

Is It Worth Quitting and Rejoining to Get a Better Sponsor?

It depends on your situation. Does your sponsor line feel more like a dead-end alley than a growth highway with no calls, no systems, no marketing tools, and an upline that couldn’t pick you out of a lineup? If so, the cost of leaving may be worth it.

Rejoining under a high-value sponsor means starting from zero. But with the right team, those losses can be short-term speed bumps. A strong sponsor team will hand you proven lead-generation systems, ongoing coaching, and a community that keeps you engaged and motivated.

We’ve seen agents plug into Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack after the reset and not only recover but exceed their previous income within a year. Why? Because they finally had the infrastructure to grow beyond what they could do alone.

Can You Change Your Co-Sponsor and How Does That Process Work?

Maybe. Co-sponsors can be changed at eXp if eXp agrees to your request. This opportunity potentially gives you flexibility to align with a secondary support team that better matches your business goals.

The Co-Sponsor Program also lets you tap into another team’s value without touching your primary sponsor relationship. It’s a smart way to excel on revenue share systems from a group like Smart Agent Alliance without altering your current setup. And unlike your primary sponsor, this relationship is more “dating app” than “marriage license.” If it’s not working, you can swipe right and potentially find a better fit.

How to Find Support if Your Sponsor Isn’t Helping

Here’s the answer: For issues with your primary sponsor, go up your upline. For co-sponsor problems, request a change. If neither works, contact eXp’s Agent Success department as the final step.

Think of your upline as a chain of up to seven agents above your sponsor, each potentially offering training, mentorship, or tools. Start with your sponsor’s sponsor (Tier 2) and keep moving upward until you find someone who can help. Many agents discover that value lives two or three tiers above, not necessarily at the bottom of the chain.

If your co-sponsor is the weak link, petition eXp to replace them with someone who brings the support you need. Still stuck? Then it’s time to call the “plumbers”, aka eXp’s Agent Success staff,  to clear the blockage.

At Smart Agent Alliance, you skip this scavenger hunt entirely. Our support is built-in from day one, so you’re never left wondering who to call or forced to escalate to DEFCON 1.

Why This Topic Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Your sponsor team isn’t just a name on your application — it’s the foundation of your long-term growth at eXp Realty. The right sponsor unlocks your upline’s resources, revenue share potential, and proven business-building systems. The wrong one can leave you isolated, without the training, tools, or connections.

At Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack, we combine the strengths of two of eXp’s most resource-rich sponsor lines so you’re not guessing or building from scratch. You get:

  • Plug into a system that’s already built to scale your production and passive income — just start driving.

Marketing Assets

Plug & Play Systems so you gain passive income:

  • Personal agent attraction page – created & hosted ($1164/yr savings)
  • Automated email campaign so you stay top of mind
  • Webinars done for your prospective agents
  • 1on 1 calls with leaders done for your prospective agents
  • Fast Track Passive Income Plan

Inspiring Community:

Run the numbers yourself with our Revenue Share Calculator. Learn more about all the details that make up eXp realty or Smart Agent Alliance. Learn everything about eXp sponsorship.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I change my eXp sponsor after I’ve joined?

No. eXp locks your sponsor choice at onboarding. The only way to change is to leave for 12 months, forfeit unvested stock, and rejoin under a new sponsor. This permanence is why vetting sponsor teams before joining is crucial.

What if I leave and return, can I pick a new sponsor?

Yes. Leaving for at least one full year resets your sponsor relationship and allows you to choose a new one when rejoining. You’ll also start from scratch on revenue share tiers and lose any unvested stock or existing downline.

Can I change my co-sponsor if I’m unhappy?

Maybe. Co-sponsors might be switched by petitioning for the change with eXp. This makes them more flexible than primary sponsors and useful for adjusting support without disrupting your main upline.

Is it worth quitting and rejoining just to change sponsors?

It can be, especially if your sponsor team adds no value and you haven’t built a large downline. Aligning with a top-tier sponsor like Smart Agent Alliance + the Wolf Pack can transform your business long-term.

What happens to my downline or benefits if I switch?

Leaving and rejoining means losing your current downline and associated revenue share income. Your benefits restart with your new sponsor and upline.

title: Do You Need a Co-Sponsor at eXp Realty?
excerpt: Key takeaway: A co-sponsor at eXp Realty is optional, but can give you access to additional systems, training, and relationships beyond your primary sponsor. Whether…
content:
Key takeaway: A co-sponsor at eXp Realty is optional, but can give you access to additional systems, training, and relationships beyond your primary sponsor. Whether you need one depends on gaps in your primary sponsor’s value and your business goals.

TL;DR About Co-Sponsors at eXp Realty

  • Optional secondary support for new agents
  • Must be named during onboarding
  • Can fill training or tool gaps in primary sponsor’s offering
  • Revenue share is earned by primary and co-sponsor
  • As co-sponsors, Smart Agent Alliance provides value of 2 agents, not just 1

If you’re joining eXp Realty, you already know you should pick a primary sponsor. That’s the easy part. But since May 2025, eXp’s thrown in a curveball: you can now name a co-sponsor. Think of it as giving someone else a seat at your support table — they get a slice of the revenue share from your deals. 

Sounds like a free upgrade, right? Not always. The right co-sponsor can plug a hole in your business plan and help you scale faster. The wrong one? Just a name on paper collecting a check that diminishes your primary sponsor’s earnings.

Do You Need a Co-Sponsor at eXp Realty?
When Does It Make Sense to Choose a Co-Sponsor?
What Kind of Value Can a Co-Sponsor Provide?
Downsides of Choosing a Co-Sponsor (Commission Splits, Timing)
What if Your Co-Sponsor is Too Involved or Redundant?
Can You Change Your Co-Sponsor Later?
How Smart Agent Alliance Supports Agents Without a Co-Sponsor

Dual Sponsorship Power
Top Real Estate Coaching:
Marketing Assets
Plug & Play Systems so you gain passive income:
Inspiring Community:
Frequently Asked Questions

Do You Need a Co-Sponsor at eXp Realty?

Here’s the deal: No, you don’t need one. Plenty of agents crush it with just a strong primary sponsor. But if yours is missing certain systems, tools, or mentoring, an eXp co-sponsor can be your secret weapon. They can open doors to specialized programs, top-tier training, or high-value connections that speed up your growth.

You add a co-sponsor after you’ve joined at eXp Realty, not on your join application (that’s reserved for your primary sponsor). Name that co-sponsor within 5 days of being active at eXp. 

Both your primary and co-sponsor get paid from eXp’s company dollar, not from your commission check. So, if they’re offering real value without charging you extra, that’s as close to a free lunch as you’ll ever get in real estate.

Example: Your primary sponsor’s a contract wizard but couldn’t teach agent attraction to save their life. Bring in a co-sponsor, like Smart Agent Alliance, and suddenly you’ve got proven funnels and recruiting strategies working for you while you sleep.

When Does It Make Sense to Choose a Co-Sponsor?

A co-sponsor is worth naming when they bring real, proven value your primary sponsor can’t or won’t provide. That could mean specialized systems, niche expertise, or marketing tools that directly move the needle for your business.

Other smart reasons?

  • You’re set on having a local sponsor for in-person support.
  • You’re navigating a personal landmine — like a friend or sibling expecting to be your sponsor — but you’d rather tap into a powerhouse eXp sponsor team for actual value. Naming them as co-sponsor can keep relationships intact and business booming.

Just remember: “nice” doesn’t equal “valuable.” Always vet your co-sponsor’s staying power and track record at eXp. The last thing you need is your secondary support ghosting you in six months, leaving nothing but dead weight on your revenue share line. And yes, sending someone a check for doing nothing won’t change your business, but it will shrink your primary sponsor’s paycheck, and you have no idea if that will affect their willingness (or ability) to go the extra mile for you later.

What Kind of Value Can a Co-Sponsor Provide?

In short: The best co-sponsors fill gaps, they don’t just clone what your primary sponsor already offers. And here’s the kicker most agents miss: a co-sponsor is just one person. Your full upline and all that potential extra value and support comes entirely from your primary sponsor. That’s why choosing the right primary matters more than any “bonus” name you tack on later.

So, what might a single eXp agent realistically bring to the table?

  • Local expertise: great for hyper-local insights, but don’t expect them to hand you their best business tips because you’re also their competition.
  • Local meetups: more face-to-face time if you thrive on in-person connection.
  • Onboarding support: getting you up and running without fumbling through the basics.
  • Weekly meetings:  just be honest with yourself… if the meetings aren’t truly valuable, you won’t attend
  • Passive income support — like done-for-you marketing funnels, webinars, calls, and automated drip campaigns for agent prospects. (Smart Agent Alliance delivers all of this as a co-sponsor and more as a primary sponsor.)

Many agents in Smart Agent Alliance bring on co-sponsors for hyper-specialized training while we, as the primary sponsor, handle the heavy lifting like core systems, weekly coaching, and the kind of team culture that keeps you engaged and producing.

Downsides of Choosing a Co-Sponsor (Commission Splits, Timing)

The biggest downside is adding someone who benefits financially from your production but contributes nothing in return leaving you frustrated and wondering why you bothered.

There’s also a hidden risk: when you add a co-sponsor, your primary sponsor earns a little less from your deals. You can’t predict if that will change their willingness to invest in you down the road.

Remember, sponsors can run “side hustles” and charge agents for access to extra value. If your primary sponsor decides to put a price tag on something you suddenly want later, that move might be more tempting for them if you’ve diminsihed their revenue with a co-sponsor.

If your primary sponsor already delivers 360° support, a co-sponsor may offer zero tangible benefit. But, if you want a co-sponsor, don’t miss the 5-day naming opportunity. Once you’re onboarded, you can’t add a co-sponsor later without leaving eXp and rejoining.

What if Your Co-Sponsor is Too Involved or Redundant?

In short: When roles overlap, you can end up with mixed messages, wasted time, or full-blown politics in your upline. It can be like having two “bosses” and you’re stuck getting too much information.

Before you add a co-sponsor, nail down exactly who’s doing what:

  • Onboarding: Who’s walking you through eXp’s systems and processes so nothing falls through the cracks?
  • Community: Whose calls are actually worth your time and which ones can you skip without missing value?
  • Training: Who’s delivering the content you truly need so you’re not drowning in duplicate sessions?
  • Recruiting: Who’s running your agent attraction systems and follow-up so prospects get a clear, unified message instead of a two-person sales pitch?

Without clearly knowing who does what best, you risk stalling your own growth while getting pulled into a tug-of-war over your business plan.

Example: We’ve seen agents join with a co-sponsor and spend their first six months bouncing between two weekly masterminds, getting conflicting marketing advice, and drowning in so many ideas they implement… none of them. That’s not “extra support”. That’s organized chaos.

A good co-sponsor amplifies your primary sponsor’s strengths. A bad one just duplicates effort, muddies direction, and drains your focus.

Can You Change Your Co-Sponsor Later?

Maybe, unlike your primary sponsor, a co-sponsor might be changed. You’ll need to petition eXp with a valid reason, and if they approve it, you can swap your current co-sponsor for another.

Sounds simple, but here’s the fine print: this rule is new, rarely tested, and there’s no public playbook on how often eXp says “yes.” Your reason might need to be more than “we don’t vibe anymore.” Think along the lines of a co-sponsor leaving eXp, failing to deliver promised value, or otherwise becoming unable to support you.

Bottom line: don’t choose a co-sponsor thinking you can easily trade them in later. Make your first choice as if you’re keeping them long-term, and treat the ability to change as a just-in-case safety net, not part of your strategy.

How Smart Agent Alliance Supports Agents Without a Co-Sponsor

Choosing whether to add a co-sponsor can shape your career from day one. If you pick the right team, you may not need one at all. At Smart Agent Alliance, we deliver both the broad foundational support and the specialized expertise other agents have to cobble together with multiple sponsors.

Here’s what you get right away when you join eXp Realty and name a Smart Agent Alliance founder as your sponsor:

Dual Sponsorship Power

  • Plug into a system that’s already built to scale your production and passive income — just start driving.
  • Built-in support from two powerful teams at eXp: Smart Agent Alliance (SAA) + the Wolf Pack
  • Zero team splits or added costs. You get just the full value of both teams, free with SAA sponsorship

Top Real Estate Coaching:

  • Weekly zoom calls with world-class training 
  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($997/yr savings)
  • AI Agent Accelerator ($997 savings)
  • Real Estate Investing ($497 savings)
  • Fast Track Agent Business Plan

Marketing Assets

  • 8 landing pages with email automation
  • 100s of beautiful ready-made marketing templates

Plug & Play Systems so you gain passive income:

  • Personal agent attraction page – created & hosted ($1164/yr savings)
  • Automated email campaign so you stay top of mind
  • Webinars done for your prospective agents
  • 1on 1 calls with leaders done for your prospective agents
  • Fast Track Passive Income Plan

Inspiring Community:

  • Weekly calls to connect with team members
  • Private referral WhatsApp groups 
  • Full access to our national and international agent network

Frequently Asked Questions

Is a Co-Sponsor Required at eXp Realty?

No. Co-sponsors are optional and must be named within 5 days of becoming active at eXp. Your primary sponsor is chosen on your join application, but a co-sponsor is added afterward. The right one can fill value gaps; the wrong one just takes a slice of your revenue share line.

Can a Co-Sponsor Be in My Local Market?

Yes. They can be anywhere eXp operates. Location doesn’t limit support, but local co-sponsors may offer in-person meetups or connections. Just make sure you’re getting real business value, not just someone to grab coffee with.

What Are the Pros and Cons of Having a Co-Sponsor?

A co-sponsor can add expertise, tools, and relationships your primary sponsor doesn’t offer. Downsides include less revenue share for your primary sponsor, possible redundancy, and risk of paying for no actual support through eXp’s company dollar.

Can I Change My Co-Sponsor Later?

Maybe. You can petition eXp Realty with a “valid” reason and potentially get a different co-sponsor.  You can’t do that with your primary sponsor. You can only add or change a primary sponsor by leaving eXp and rejoining.

What Happens If I Don’t Pick a Co-Sponsor? Will I Miss Out?

Not if you have a strong primary sponsor. Many agents, especially in Smart Agent Alliance, skip co-sponsors and still get more value than most agents juggling two sponsors.

content:
Key takeaway: Yes. eXp Realty requires every new agent to name a primary sponsor on their application. This choice is permanent unless you leave for 12 months. The right sponsor unlocks training, systems, and a motivated upline. The wrong one? You’ll get radio silence and zero added value.

TL;DR About Sponsors at eXp Realty

  • Required on every new agent application
  • Unlocks your full 7-level upline support
  • Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack = double the value
  • Permanent unless you exit for a year
  • Wrong choice = no support, no network

Joining eXp Realty isn’t like walking into a brick-and-mortar office and shaking hands with your broker-in-charge. Every agent gets eXp’s unmatched tech, training, and national community. That’s the baseline. 

But your primary sponsor, the person you name on your application, can pile on even more: private masterminds, done-for-you marketing tools, and direct access to leaders who actually know your name. 

Pick right, and you’ll plug into a support line that accelerates your production and even does the hard lifting for you to gain a passive income stream. Pick wrong, and you’ll be alone at 2 a.m. Googling “how to get into eXp World.” Oh, and you only get one shot at naming them. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Do You Need a Sponsor at eXp Realty?

Do You Need a Sponsor at eXp Realty?

In short: Yes. eXp Realty gives you one opportuntiy to name a sponsor when joining eXp, and that choice is permanent unless you leave for 12 months. It’s not just a form to fill—it decides which upline you’ll be connected to for support, resources, and mentorship.

This isn’t a ceremonial title. Your sponsor is the gatekeeper to extra potential value like exclusive trainings, marketing systems, community, and leadership access that can fast-track your growth. Some sponsors vanish after you sign; others, like Smart Agent Alliance + the Wolf Pack, actually show up. Ours launches you with onboarding help, live masterminds, and training that will move your do-more-deals needle. 

How a Good Sponsor Affects Your Income Potential

A strong sponsor line can increase both your commission income and passive revenue share earnings. They might hand you proven systems, lead funnels, and attraction tools you’d otherwise have to build, and pay for, yourself.

For example, Smart Agent Alliance agents launch with branded lead-gen landing pages,  stay top of mind prospect email drips, and a turnkey agent attraction funnel—day one. That means they’re closing transactions faster and building a passive income stream most agents don’t even consider until year two—right about the time they see their friends cashing revenue share checks and start Googling “how to change your sponsor at eXp” (spoiler: you can’t).

How Strong Sponsor Support Leads to More Production and Retention

The bottom line: Agents with engaged sponsors close more deals and stay at eXp longer. Support breeds confidence, confidence breeds production, and production breeds retention.

Inside Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack, agents get weekly top strategies ideas, a supportive community, and direct access to leaders like Mike Sherrard. That’s why this sponsor line has some of the highest retention rates in the company, and why “burnout” isn’t in our vocabulary.

What Should New Agents Look for in a Sponsor?

Here’s the answer: Choose a sponsor who shows up on day one with proven systems, structured onboarding, and the organization to help you close more deals immediately. They should pour into you for free—no hidden “coaching packages” or upsells later. And make sure they have a plan for passive income support; ignoring that is the #1 regret of current eXp agents.

Avoid “promises tomorrow” and pick “proven today.” Pro tip: Ask exactly what you’ll get the moment you join. If the answer is vague, filled with buzzwords, or sounds like they’re stalling for time, keep moving. You don’t need a motivational pen pal; you need a sponsor who delivers results.

Will eXp Assign a Sponsor If You Skip That Field?

In short: No. While eXp used to assign a random sponsor, the current practice is to leave your upline blank if you don’t name one. That means you’ll have no primary sponsor, and no extra layer of support, without intentionally choosing a sponsor.

On paper, that might sound harmless. In reality, you’re opting out of the free coaching, systems, and community that great sponsors provide. Without a sponsor, you’ll only get eXp’s standard tools and training which, while they are great, they are not the private masterminds, onboarding help, or revenue share guidance that can transform your business. If you’re joining anyway, why pass up the chance to connect with a powerhouse team like Smart Agent Alliance that’s built to fast-track both your production and passive income?

Pro tip: When you fill out your eXp application, double-check the sponsor field before you hit submit because if it’s blank, you can’t retroactively claim the value of a top-tier sponsor team. However, if you realize the mistake before you’re active at eXp, you can contact eXp Support to correct it. Once you’re active with eXp, your only option is leaving for 12 months and rejoining.

Do Unassigned Agents Still Contribute to the Rev Share Pool?

Yes. Your commissions still trigger revenue share payouts even if you don’t name a sponsor. The catch? You have no control over who gets paid, and they won’t lift a finger to help you, mostly because they have no idea you exist.

Why don’t they know? Because without a sponsor, the money your deals generate gets tossed into a bonus pool paid to Tiers 1–3 in someone else’s upline. It’s not personal. It’s just math. That “extra” is pulled from eXp’s 20% company dollar until you cap, so it doesn’t feel like a bill, but it is money you could have working for you.

Going sponsorless is like paying for a subscription you never use, except the “service” you’re skipping is support, training, and growth guidance. Handing free income to a random agent with no expectation of return is business malpractice. With Smart Agent Alliance, every dollar you generate also funds your free tools, live masterminds, and done-for-you agent attraction funnel so you actually see a return on the revenue you create. 

Can I Attract an eXp Downline if I Don’t Have an Upline?

Yes, but if you don’t have a primary sponsor, the smartest move is to become the co-sponsor for your recruits and partner with a powerhouse primary sponsor team. That way you can leverage their proven systems, training, and credibility to attract agents to join eXp while you still earn 7 levels of revenue share.

Here’s why it matters: Without a strong sponsor line, attracting and keeping agents is an uphill climb. Your recruits will want to know what kind of onboarding, coaching, and resources they’ll get. If the only answer is “me,” you’re asking them to buy into an untested solo act. By teaming up with a proven sponsor team, like Smart Agent Alliance, as the primary sponsor, you can instantly leverage their full stack of value to attract agents. Meet the proven sponsor teams guidelines and you can even earn the use of the sponsor’s value for your personal use.

By promoting a strong sponsor to be the primary sponsor, you still get credit as the co-sponsor, meaning you participate in 7 levels of revenue share. The difference is, now your recruits stay longer, produce more, and bring in their own agents because they’re plugged into a sponsor line with a track record of winning. Co-sponsoring isn’t just a workaround; it’s the leverage play that lets you build a downline without building the infrastructure from scratch. Learn more about eXp co-sponsorship here.

Why This Topic Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Choosing your primary sponsor is one of the few decisions at eXp you can’t undo. Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack gives you:

Dual Sponsorship Power

  • Built-in support from two powerful teams at eXp: Smart Agent Alliance (SAA) + the Wolf Pack
  • Zero team splits or added costs. You get just the full value of both teams, free with SAA sponsorship
  • Plug into a system that’s already built to scale your production and passive income — just start driving.

Top Real Estate Coaching:

  • Weekly zoom calls with world-class training 
  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($997/yr savings)
  • AI Agent Accelerator ($997 savings)
  • Real Estate Investing ($497 savings)
  • Fast Track Agent Business Plan

Inspiring Community:

  • Weekly calls to connect with team members
  • Private referral WhatsApp groups 
  • Full access to our national and international agent network

Plug & Play Systems so you gain passive income:

  • Personal agent attraction page – created & hosted ($1164/yr savings)
  • Automated email campaign so you stay top of mind
  • Webinars done for your prospective agents
  • 1on 1 calls with leaders done for your prospective agents
  • Fast Track Passive Income Plan

Marketing Assets

  • 8 landing pages with email automation
  • 100s of beautiful ready-made marketing templates

Curious how this stacks up to what you’re currently getting (or not getting)? Check out our eXp Commission and Fees Calculator. Interested in passive income opportunities? Run the numbers yourself with our Revenue Share Calculator. Learn more about all the details that make up eXp realty or Smart Agent Alliance. Learn everything about eXp sponsorship.

Join with the right sponsor, and you’ll have the tools to scale your production and build passive income without extra overhead.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do I Need to Choose a Sponsor to Join eXp Realty?

No, but skipping it means no extra systems, coaching, or credibility to help you grow. If you want a downline, pair with a proven primary sponsor and step in as co-sponsor where you’ll still earn 7 levels of rev share while your recruits get top-tier support.

Does eXp Assign Me a Sponsor If I Leave the Field Blank?

No. eXp’s current practice is to leave your upline blank if you don’t name a sponsor. You can fix it before you’re active by contacting eXp Support, but once active, your only option is leaving for 12 months and rejoining.

Will My Commissions Go to Someone If I Don’t Name a Sponsor?

Yes. Without a sponsor, the revenue share from your deals goes into a bonus pool for someone else’s Tier 1–3. They won’t know you, so they won’t help you because they don’t even know you’re paying them.

Can I Get Support If I Don’t Have a Sponsor?

You’ll get eXp’s baseline tools, training, and community, but nothing extra. No private masterminds, no done-for-you marketing systems, no onboarding help. If you want those, choose a sponsor team that actually delivers them.

What’s the Benefit of Having a Strong Upline or Value Stack?

A strong upline gives your business layered support with multiple leaders, proven systems, and a network invested in your success. Plus, it provides you with a value stack to attract your own downline for passive income.

Can the Right eXp Sponsor Team Transform My Career?

Yes. The right team can accelerate production, shorten your learning curve, and set you up for long-term passive income. Smart Agent Alliance does this with onboarding help, live masterminds, free attraction funnels, top AI u0026amp; Social Media training, and direct access to leaders who actually show up.

Can I Build Revenue Share Without a Sponsor?

Yes, but it’s harder. Without a sponsor line, you lose the systems, events, and credibility that make it easier to attract and keep agents. A smarter play is u003ca href=u0022https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/exp-realty-sponsor/program-basicsu0022u003eto co-sponsor with a proven primary sponsoru003c/au003e so you still earn 7 levels of rev share while your recruits get top-tier support.

What’s the Fastest Way to Start a Downline at eXp?

Partner with a sponsor team that already has a full recruiting engine like a branded attraction site, leadership-led calls, and follow-up campaigns. Smart Agent Alliance gives you all of this on day one so you can start enrolling agents without building the infrastructure yourself.

Key takeaway: At eXp Realty, a sponsor is the agent you name when joining who most influenced your decision to sign up. They’re not your boss. They’re your connection to an upline network, with potentially tools, training, community, and mentorship. The right sponsor can shortcut your success; the wrong one can leave you ghosted with zero support.

TL;DR About What eXp Sponsors Do

  • Connect you to your seven-tier upline at eXp Realty
  • Provide mentorship, systems, and agent attraction tools
  • No required support — sponsors choose their involvement level
  • Big-name sponsors bring reach; engaged ones bring results
  • Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack = double the value stack

Ever joined a brokerage thinking you’d get hands-on guidance, only to find your mentor’s “support” was an occasional email? At eXp, your sponsor isn’t just a name on your application — they’re your first link in a seven-tier upline that can unlock training, marketing tools, and collaboration opportunities.

 But the value you get in an eXp sponsor isn’t automatic. Some sponsors bring full systems, lead funnels, and active coaching. Some sponsors are hands-on, investing real time and money into your success. Others… well, let’s just say their version of “support” is liking your Instagram post once a year.

What Is an Upline and Why Does It Matter?

Your upline is the chain of up to seven agents above you at eXp Realty, starting with your sponsor. Their skills, systems, and involvement directly affect your access to training, tools, and mentorship. A strong upline can fast-track your growth; a weak one leaves you figuring it out alone.

At eXp Realty, your sponsor is just the start. The agents above them — your Tier 2 through Tier 7 upline — can collectively be a goldmine of resources, or a ghost town. This isn’t corporate HR; it’s a network where access is earned by choosing wisely on day one.

Example: Doug Smart and Karrie Hill’s Smart Agent Alliance connects you not only to their systems but also to the Wolf Pack’s national reach. That means you benefit from two leadership teams with proven track records in different market conditions — a built-in safety net of experience you can’t build solo.

What Kind of Support Can a Sponsor Provide at eXp?

At eXp, sponsor support isn’t mandated. Support ranges from nothing to full-blown business systems. The best sponsors provide training, lead-gen tools, marketing assets, step-by-step attraction systems and an actual supportive community that cares about you. I know, imagine that!

When you choose well, your sponsor can hand you ready-made tools that cover everything you need to up your real estate agent game. They’ll also connect you to a community that shares ideas, collaborates on deals, and helps you adapt to market changes faster than if you were working alone.

Examples from Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack:

  • Nick D. – Facebook Groups to Triple Production
    In a saturated second-home market with over 500 agents, Nick built a niche buyer-focused Facebook group that 3X’d his business in 12 months — no ads, no cold calls, no spam. Just the right systems and guidance to turn community into contracts.
  • Stacey – 54 Deals from Local Networking Groups
    Starting in a brand-new market with zero contacts, Stacey closed 54 deals in one year by strategically joining and leading local business networking groups. No video, no paid ads — just relationship-based systems that make her a referral magnet.
  • Slater S. – One FSBO Listing Every Week
    Slater, a Seattle-based agent, generates a steady pipeline of high-value listings using a proven FSBO calling and follow-up system. The result? Over $5M under contract in just one quarter, all from free, repeatable scripts that work in any market.

The pattern is clear: the right sponsor doesn’t just offer help — they provide repeatable systems that anyone can plug into for predictable results.

Do eXp Sponsors Have Any Obligation to Help Their Downline?

No. eXp Realty does not require sponsors to provide any form of support. Whether you get hands-on help or radio silence depends entirely on the sponsor you choose.

This is one of the most misunderstood parts of the eXp Realty model. Sponsors earn revenue share from the company dollar when their downline closes deals, but they are under zero obligation to teach you how to make those deals happen.

This is one of the most misunderstood parts of the eXp Realty model. Sponsors earn revenue share from the company dollar when their downline closes deals, but they are under zero obligation to teach you how to make those deals happen.

That’s why your decision is so critical. If you pick a sponsor without systems or accountability in place, they have no incentive to build them later. You could be left piecing together a business model from random YouTube videos and free Facebook groups — not exactly a competitive advantage.

Example: With Smart Agent Alliance, you step into a full infrastructure on day one — from onboarding checklists to niche lead-gen playbooks like FSBO outreach or networking-based referral systems. There’s no “figure it out yourself” phase.

Why Do Some eXp Sponsors Offer More Value than Others?

Some sponsors see revenue share as an investment in their agents’ success; others see it as passive income they don’t need to earn. The best sponsors reinvest in proven tools, training, and systems to help you succeed.

The value you get from a sponsor usually depends on their mindset, resources, and track record. A solo agent sponsor may have great intentions but lack the time or systems to help more than a few agents. On the other hand, a sponsor embedded in a high-performance team can plug you into shared resources that scale without losing personal touch.

The Wolf Pack and Smart Agent Alliance combo works because both have complementary strengths:

  • SAA brings hands-on onboarding, plug-and-play marketing systems and agent attraction tools
  • Wolf Pack delivers national training, niche growth strategies, and access to leaders like Mike Sherrard, who have coached agents to success in nearly every market condition.

Sponsors who deliver real value do so consistently, regardless of market shifts. That’s the kind of stability agents need to thrive long-term.

What Happens if Your Sponsor or Upline Stops Providing Support?

If your sponsor or upline stops engaging, you keep their name in your record and lose their direct involvement. eXp will not replace them, and your only way to change is to leave for 12 months and rejoin.

This is where agents who didn’t vet their sponsor up front get stuck. Losing sponsor support doesn’t mean losing eXp’s brokerage-level help — you’ll still get tech, compliance, and transaction assistance — but the personalized guidance and systems you counted on may vanish overnight.

The key is to pick a sponsor with a history of sustained involvement. Look for evidence of active mastermind groups, ongoing content creation, and consistent agent wins — not just a flashy sales pitch.

Example: Smart Agent Alliance with the Wolf Pack has maintained weekly training calls for years, even through market downturns, platform changes, and shifting trends. Agents know they can count on the same level of support next year as they do today.

How Is Sponsor Support Different from Brokerage-Level Support?

Brokerage-level support at eXp covers contracts, compliance, and core tools. Sponsor support is about growth — lead generation, business strategy, and mentorship tailored to your goals.

Think of it this way: eXp gives you the tools, but your sponsor gives you the blueprint. Without a strong sponsor, you might have the hammer, nails, and lumber — but no plan for the house you’re trying to build.

Brokerage-level support ensures you can complete transactions compliantly. Sponsor support teaches you how to find those transactions in the first place, close them faster, and generate referrals for years to come.

Example: A sponsor who provides a Facebook group strategy that generates triple production (like Nick D.’s) is delivering something brokerage-level resources can’t match — direct market-tested playbooks that bring in warm, high-intent leads.

Why This Topic Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Your sponsor choice determines your upline, the systems you can access, and the speed at which you can grow. A co-sponsor can add extra local or niche expertise — but only if they’re willing and able to deliver.

At eXp, you’re not just joining a brokerage — you’re joining a network. The wrong sponsor can leave you on your own with generic training and no market-specific guidance. The right one gives you leverage on day one, with proven strategies, clear action plans, and leaders who’ve succeeded in the exact business models you want to run.

What you get with Smart Agent Alliance (sponsor team)

Dual Sponsorship Power

  • Built-in support from two powerful teams at eXp: Smart Agent Alliance (SAA) + the Wolf Pack
  • Zero team splits or added costs. You get just the full value of both teams, free with SAA sponsorship
  • Plug into a system that’s already built to scale your production and passive income — just start driving.

Top Real Estate Coaching:

  • Weekly Zoom calls with world-class training
  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($997/yr savings)
  • AI Agent Accelerator ($997 savings)
  • Real Estate Investing ($497 savings)
  • Fast Track Agent Business Plan

Marketing Assets

  • 8 landing pages with email automation
  • 100s of beautiful, ready-made marketing templates

Plug & Play Systems for you to gain passive income:

  • Personal agent attraction page – created & hosted ($1164/yr savings)
  • Automated email campaign so you stay top of mind
  • Webinars done for your prospective agents
  • 1-on-1 calls with leaders done for your prospective agents
  • Fast Track Passive Income Plan

Inspiring Community:

  • Weekly calls to connect with team members
  • Private referral WhatsApp groups
  • Full access to our national and international agent network

Curious how this stacks up to what you’re currently getting (or not getting)? Check out our eXp Commission and Fees Calculator. Interested in passive income opportunities? Run the numbers yourself with our Revenue Share Calculator. Learn more about all the details that make up eXp realty or Smart Agent Alliance.  Learn all the eXp Sponsor Program Basics.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do all eXp sponsors help their agents?

No. Some provide full systems; others do nothing. Always ask for specifics before joining.

What happens if my sponsor leaves eXp Realty?

You stay in the same upline. If they still participate, great; if not, you lose their direct involvement.

Will I get help from a big-name sponsor like Mike Sherrard?

If you’re in his downline (like with Smart Agent Alliance), yes — he’s part of your support team. However, Mike doesn’t accept any direct agents, so you’ll need to join someone in his downline.

How do I know if a sponsor will actually support me?

Ask for a detailed list of what they provide and verify what they say.

Can my sponsor change their level of involvement later?

Yes. There’s no contractual requirement for them to maintain support. Choose based on proven consistency.

Why don’t upline partners share their support with co-sponsors?

Because it dilutes value, creates extra work without extra pay, and can harm paying members’ benefits.

What Is an eXp Sponsor and Co-Sponsor at eXp Realty?

Your sponsor is the licensed agent you name on your join eXp application. They are the one who “most influenced you to join eXp”. They’re your official connection to the layers of upline agents above you in the company.

A co-sponsor is optional and can be added within 5 days after onboarding for extra personal support. They don’t link you to their upline; they only provide what they personally bring to the table.

Think “power grid” vs. “desk lamp.” You can survive with a desk lamp, but why not tap into the best grid from day one?

Example: Angela names Smart Agent Alliance as sponsor to connect to an international network and a huge value stack. She adds a local co-sponsor for neighborhood-specific tactics. Now she has the full business engine and a hyperlocal GPS.

What eXp Sponsors Do (And Why the Right One Changes Everything)

Read our full guide to what eXp sponsors can do for you for more details.

At eXp, sponsors aren’t required to help their agents — but the best ones treat it like a business partnership and give you serious leverage. That can mean plug-and-play systems, marketing tools, recruiting funnels, mastermind access, and a community you can lean on daily.

Sponsor involvement varies wildly. Some offer value worth tens of thousands in saved time and trial-and-error. Others… well, you’ll have an easier time getting a price reduction from a seller mid-escrow.

When your sponsor is part of a high-performing sponsor team like Smart Agent Alliance + Wolf Pack, you inherit years of proven strategies, national referral connections, and a culture of collaboration. That’s the difference between figuring it out alone and plugging into a machine that’s already built to scale.

Example: One Wolf Pack agent in a small coastal market tripled GCI in 12 months using our team’s YouTube + Facebook group playbook without buying a single lead. That’s the power of a sponsor team that invests in your growth, not just your headcount.

Primary Sponsor Rules at eXp Realty: What to Know Before You Commit

Read our full guide to Primary Sponsors at eXp for deeper detail.

Your primary sponsor choice shapes your entire upline and is locked once you’re “active.” You can name any active eXp agent, but after activation, if you’re unhappy with your choice, you’ll have to make life altering sacrifices to make a change…more on that below.

The lone exception for a quick change is if you made a mistake in your eXp application and you catch it before you go active at eXp. Contact onboarding support in that case to fix it.

You can join eXp without naming a sponsor, but you’ll get only eXp’s baseline tools which are, in fact, industry gold standards.  But you won’t get extra sponsor team systems. No extra training, community, or other support.

Bottom line: this is one of the most important choices you’ll make when you join eXp. Get it right, and you’re tapped into proven systems, ones that can motivate and inspire you, from day one. Get it wrong, and you’re on your own trying to navigate eXp World without a map.

Do You Need a Co-Sponsor at eXp Realty?

Read our full guide to eXp Co-Sponsorship for all the nitty gritty details.

No, co-sponsors are optional. Like we already mentioned, you can add one within 5 days of being “active” at eXp. You can also can request a change of co-sponsor later by petition if you have a valid reason. Co-sponsors don’t connect you to their upline. Their benefit is whatever they personally bring to you.

A great co-sponsor fills gaps your primary sponsor can’t. Think hyperlocal market knowledge, niche marketing skills, or one-on-one deal support. A bad one is just another person collecting a slice of the company dollar without moving your business forward.

Example: You join Smart Agent Alliance for top training, national systems and attraction strategies. You add a local top producer as co-sponsor for farm-area pricing tactics and contract reviews. The result? A full-scale business engine plus a custom spotlight on your exact market.

Can You Change Your Sponsor at eXp Realty?

Read our full guide about changing eXp sponsors to get the details.

Once you’re active, your primary sponsor is locked in permanently. The only way to choose a new one is to leave eXp for a full 12 months and then rejoin.  Making that move means forfeiting any unvested stock and walking away from your existing downline. As we already mentioned, eXp doesn’t make exceptions unless there’s a user error caught before approval.

This is why you don’t pick your sponsor casually. You’re not choosing a lunch buddy; you’re choosing a long-term business partner who controls your access to an entire upline’s systems, training, and community. So, carefully vet your sponsor team’s value before you join.

Co-sponsors are a little different. You can petition to change them if there’s a valid reason, but approval isn’t guaranteed. So, apply the same due diligence in choosing a great co-sponsor for you. If they can’t clearly explain what they’ll provide, skip them.

Pro tip: When a sponsor says they offer weekly meetings, ask how many agents actually show up. Our team calls pull in 100–200 agents every call. Our team calls pull in 100–200 agents every week — pretty sure that’s the highest attendance rate at eXp. Attendance is a clear sign of where the real value is… and where it isn’t.

eXp Sponsor Team vs. Real Estate Production Team — Key Differences

Read our full guide to the difference between eXp sponsor teams and real estate production teams for more details.

Sponsor teams = scalable systems, upline resources, and revenue share potential.
Production teams = shared deals, leads, and commission splits.

You can (and many do) join both. Agents join production teams for boots-on-the-ground deal flow today and sponsor teams for niche training, motivation, and scalable, passive income for tomorrow.

As you know, a sponsor team, which can exist anywhere in the world, connects you to your 7-level upline and the value they’ve built. A production team, on the other hand, is local and transaction-focused. You’ll typically share leads, split commissions, pool marketing costs, and lean on team transaction support. It’s great for short-term cash flow, but the benefits end when the deals do.

Many Smart Agent Alliance agents run with both setups: one that pays you today, and one that keeps paying you long after the deal paperwork is filed away. It’s the difference between owning a rental property and having a weekend yard sale — one builds lasting income, the other keeps you hustling for the next Saturday.

Quick Comparison

eXp Sponsor vs. Mentor — What’s the Real Difference?

Read our full guide to eXp sponsors vs. eXp mentors for the deeper details.

By now you know the drill that a sponsor is permanent and tied to your revenue share. A mentor is temporary and assigned to agents with fewer than three closed transactions in the past 12 months. Their job is to guide you through your first deals, help with contracts and transaction flow until you “graduate” from the program.

One is your long-term business partner; the other is your on-ramp coach. Sponsors can (and often do) offer creative, exclusive value like marketing funnels, training libraries, and mastermind groups. Mentors stick to the eXp-approved curriculum and transaction support.

Sometimes, your eXp certified mentor and eXp sponsor are the same person — which, if you pick well, means seamless onboarding and long-term growth under one roof. But don’t confuse the two: a mentor is there to make sure your early transactions don’t implode, while your sponsor is there to make sure your career doesn’t.

What eXp Sponsorship Means for Team Leaders at eXp Realty

Read our full guide to eXp sponsors for team leaders for more details.

For team leaders, sponsorship is completely separate from any production team agreement. You can keep your brand, splits, and operations exactly as they are while plugging your entire roster into a powerhouse upline.

Your agents keep working under your leadership, but — if your sponsor offers real value — they also gain access to additional systems, training, and a wider network layered on top of what you already provide.

For agents already at eXp, the new co-sponsor program makes it possible to future-proof your recruiting. You can’t change your own sponsor, but you can have any new recruits name Smart Agent Alliance as their sponsor and you as their co-sponsor.

They’ll still get your leadership, and you’ll be able to leverage a complete value stack you didn’t have to spend time or money building. Best of all, you still unlock 7 tiers of revenue share and the Fast Start bonus.

Why This Topic Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Your sponsor team controls your access to upline resources, passive income potential, and whether you’ll have to reinvent the wheel or just start driving. Choose a team like Smart Agent Alliance + the Wolf Pack and you’ll get:

Dual Sponsorship Power

  • Plug into a system that’s already built to scale your production and passive income — just start driving.
  • Built-in support from two powerful teams at eXp: Smart Agent Alliance (SAA) + the Wolf Pack
  • Zero team splits or added costs. You get just the full value of both teams, free with SAA sponsorship

Top Real Estate Coaching:

  • Weekly zoom calls with world-class training
  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($997/yr savings)
  • AI Agent Accelerator ($997 savings)
  • Real Estate Investing ($497 savings)
  • Fast Track Agent Business Plan

Marketing Assets

  • 8 landing pages with email automation
  • 100s of beautiful ready-made marketing templates

Inspiring Community:

  • Weekly calls to connect with team members
  • Private referral WhatsApp groups
  • Full access to our national and international agent network

Plug & Play Systems so you gain passive income:

  • Personal agent attraction page – created & hosted ($1164/yr savings)
  • Automated email campaign so you stay top of mind
  • Webinars done for your prospective agents
  • 1on 1 calls with leaders done for your prospective agents
  • Fast Track Passive Income Plan

Plug & Play Systems so you gain passive income:

  • Personal agent attraction page – created & hosted ($1164/yr savings)
  • Automated email campaign so you stay top of mind
  • Webinars done for your prospective agents
  • 1on 1 calls with leaders done for your prospective agents
  • Fast Track Passive Income Plan

Curious how this stacks up to what you’re currently getting (or not getting)? Check out our eXp Commission and Fees Calculator. Interested in passive income opportunities? Run the numbers yourself with our Revenue Share Calculator. Learn more about all the details that make up eXp realty or Smart Agent Alliance.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do I have to name a sponsor when I join eXp Realty?

No. You can join without naming a sponsor. If you leave the sponsor field blank, you’ll go active without one and eXp will not assign one for you. But without a sponsor, you’ll miss all the extra training, systems, and community that come from being plugged into a powerhouse sponsor team.

What’s the difference between a sponsor and a co-sponsor at eXp?

A sponsor is the licensed agent you name on your join application, and they connect you to their entire upline (up to seven tiers). A co-sponsor is optional, must be added within 5 days, and only gives you access to what they personally provide, not their upline.

Can I change my sponsor at eXp Realty?

Not once you’re active. The only way to change a primary sponsor is to leave eXp for 12 months, forfeit unvested stock, and rejoin. The only exception is if eXp catches an “mistake” you made on your application before approval.

Can I change my co-sponsor?

Maybe. You can petition eXp to change your co-sponsor if there’s a valid reason. Approval is not guaranteed, so it’s best to choose carefully up front.

What do good sponsors actually provide at eXp?

The best sponsors build complete business ecosystems: plug-and-play marketing systems, recruiting funnels, weekly masterminds, and engaged communities. Others may provide very little. At eXp, sponsor support isn’t required, so your experience depends on who you choose.

What’s the difference between a sponsor and a mentor at eXp Realty?

A sponsor is permanent and tied to your revenue share. A mentor is temporary, assigned to agents with fewer than three deals in the past 12 months, and helps you complete your first transactions. Sometimes they’re the same person, but they serve very different roles.

How does sponsorship affect team leaders?

Sponsorship is separate from production team agreements. You can keep your brand, splits, and operations while plugging your roster into your sponsor’s upline systems. With the new co-sponsor program, even existing eXp leaders can recruit agents who name Smart Agent Alliance as sponsor and themselves as co-sponsor — unlocking recruiting leverage without rebuilding a value stack from scratch.

Why is sponsor choice so important at eXp?

Because it’s permanent after activation and it dictates the resources, systems, and community you can access. Pick right, and you’re ramping like a Tesla. Pick wrong, and you’re pedaling uphill with no map.

title: What Is an eXp Sponsor and Co-Sponsor?
excerpt: Key takeaway: An eXp sponsor is the agent who most influenced you to join and is named on your application. A co-sponsor is optional and…
content:
Key takeaway: An eXp sponsor is the agent who most influenced you to join and is named on your application. A co-sponsor is optional and can be added after onboarding within five days. You only get upline access through your primary sponsor. Choose based on real support, systems, and accountability.

TL;DR About exp realty sponsor and co-sponsor

  • Primary sponsor chosen during onboarding at eXp Realty
  • Optional co-sponsor added within five days after you join
  • Only your sponsor’s upline supports you, not your co-sponsor’s
  • Changes are rare, but co-sponsor changes may be possible for cause
  • Smart Agent Alliance offers full systems, training, and local support

If you are considering eXp Realty, your sponsor choice sets the tone for your first year. It shapes your training, your community, and how fast you ramp up. The co-sponsor program gives you one more point of contact, often local, so you are not choosing between community and proximity. This article explains how it all works without the fluff and shows you how to pick wisely. Here’s your handy-dandy index:

What is an eXp Sponsor and how are they named?

What Is a Co-Sponsor and How Do You Select One?

What is an eXp Sponsor and how are they named?

In short: Your eXp sponsor is the licensed agent who most influenced your decision to join. You name them on your join eXp Realty application. That choice locks in your support line and determines which upline, systems, and communities you can access. If your sponsor is well-organized, you’ll gain value far beyond eXp’s standard tools.

Sponsors are paid from eXp’s company dollar, so their support doesn’t cost you extra. But not all sponsors actually deliver value—some promise big and give little and others charge you a fee (but eXp Realty doesn’t charge anything).

Agents who rush this choice often regret it, finding themselves without the systems, coaching, or connections that shorten ramp time and boost income. Pick a sponsor team that already delivers real value today, not promises tomorrow.

How to name your sponsor correctly

  1. Start your eXp Realty application.
  2. In the Sponsor field, enter your sponsor’s legal name.
  3. Confirm spelling and license status with the sponsor.
  4. Keep a screenshot of your entry for your records.

What good sponsors actually do

  • Help you close more deals faster
  • Provide high-quality training that goes beyond the basics
  • Supply marketing assets and templates
  • Offer consistent weekly meetings for the community and support
  • Teach you how to create a revenue share income stream
  • Deliver value without charging extra

Example – Jasmine’s Ramp-Up Success: Jasmine left a small local brokerage wanting accountability and proven systems. Her chosen sponsor team ran weekly Zooms, gave her turnkey marketing materials, and shared top agent strategies from their upline. She went from months-long ramp times to closings within weeks, staying motivated because she had both structure and community.

What Is a Co-Sponsor and How Do You Select One?

A co-sponsor is an optional secondary guide you can add within five days after your eXp activation. Unlike your primary sponsor, they don’t give you access to an upline. Their value comes from what they personally provide.

The right co-sponsor can give you hyperlocal insights, niche skills, or hands-on shadowing opportunities. The wrong one is just another name on paper, offering little or no support. Many top-performing agents skip co-sponsors entirely if their sponsor team already meets all their needs.

How the co-sponsor program works

  • Added after onboarding, within five days of your active date
  • Only one person can be your co-sponsor
  • Co-sponsor gets revenue share from the company dollar, not your split
  • No access to the co-sponsor’s upline or systems

How to choose a co-sponsor

  1. Decide whether you want local knowledge or a niche skill.
  2. Confirm they have time and clear deliverables.
  3. Ask for specifics, not vague support. Example: “Two shadow days a month,” or “Listing presentation review within 48 hours.”
  4. Add their name during your co-sponsor window.

Example: Mix and match

  • Sponsor: Smart Agent Alliance for systems, training, and a deep upline.
  • Co-sponsor: A top local agent who meets you for tours, contract reviews, and market-specific tips.

How Long Is Your Sponsor Linked to You at eXp Realty?

Your sponsor is linked for your entire time at eXp. The only way to choose a new one is to leave for a full twelve months and then rejoin. Co-sponsors follow the same concept, though they can sometimes be changed by request if there’s a valid reason.

This policy is why the sponsor choice is so critical. Agents who pick without vetting often feel stuck when their sponsor’s promises don’t pan out.

Sponsor link timeline

Example – Diego’s Long-Term Win: Diego joined in March and named Ana as sponsor. Three years later, he considered switching but stayed because her coaching still delivered results. His early choice set him up for consistent growth without disruption.

What Happens if You Don’t Name a Sponsor When Joining?

You can join eXp without a sponsor, but you’ll miss out on access to a sponsor’s upline, systems, and extra training. You’ll still get eXp’s core tools, but your growth will rely entirely on what you build yourself. Once onboarding is complete, you can’t add a sponsor without leaving for 12 months.

Many agents who join sponsorless end up with slower ramp times, less accountability, and fewer lead-generation opportunities. A co-sponsor cannot replace the missing sponsor role.

Pros and cons of joining without a sponsor

Example – Chris’s Missed Leverage: Chris joined sponsorless to “figure it out later.” Six months in, he realized he needed advanced scripts and listing help. His only path was to leave for a year and rejoin, delaying his business growth.

What Are the Differences Between a Sponsor and a Co-Sponsor?

Your eXp sponsor is your primary business influencer and the only one who connects you to an upline. A co-sponsor is an optional, single additional helper you choose after joining. Both may earn revenue share from the company dollar, but only your sponsor’s upline structure will ever factor into your long-term support and growth potential.

Choosing wisely matters because your sponsor’s systems, community, and leadership can accelerate your production or leave you figuring things out alone. A co-sponsor might provide valuable niche knowledge or local insight, but they cannot replace a strong primary sponsor. Many agents mistakenly believe a co-sponsor can “fix” a weak sponsor choice, only to find their growth stalls.

Comparison at a glance

Example: How to split roles
Angela joins eXp and names a sponsor who provides her with weekly training calls, ready-to-use marketing templates, and agent attraction support from their upline team. She also selects a co-sponsor who specializes in her farm area, meeting her twice a month for market strategy. The combination gives her both broad business growth and hyperlocal execution.

What Are Your Options if You Joined Without Naming a Sponsor?

If you join eXp without a sponsor, your options are extremely limited after onboarding. You may correct a clear error before approval, but once active, the only way to gain a sponsor is to leave for twelve months and rejoin. A co-sponsor cannot fill this gap. They are an add-on, not a substitute for a primary sponsor.

This matters because agents without a sponsor lose direct access to proven upline systems, mentorship, and extra marketing tools. While eXp’s core training is solid, going sponsorless often means a slower ramp-up, fewer warm leads, and more trial-and-error. Many agents regret the decision after realizing they could have leveraged a sponsor’s ready-made playbooks from day one.

Decision tree:

  • Add a co-sponsor only within the open window and only if you already have a sponsor in place.
  • Are you still in onboarding? If yes, you may correct a documented mistake with eXp support.
  • If you’ve already been approved, plan a 12-month exit before returning with your chosen sponsor.

Example: Clean reset

Leah joined without a sponsor, thinking she could “test drive” eXp first. Six months in, she realized she needed high-level scripts, marketing templates, and accountability her core training didn’t provide. After a 12-month break, she rejoined under Smart Agent Alliance for business systems and added a local co-sponsor for hyper-targeted neighborhood strategy — this time building momentum from day one.

Why This Topic Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

The bottom line: Your sponsor choice controls your access to a working upline and potential to get real systems, training, and community. Your co-sponsor adds one more human, often local. You deserve both speed and proximity. Smart Agent Alliance gives you the stack you need so you’ll thrive at eXp Realty.

Dual Sponsorship Power

  • Zero team splits or added costs. You get just the full value of both teams, free with SAA sponsorship
  • Plug into a system that’s already built to scale your production and passive income — just start driving.

Marketing Assets

Plug & Play Systems, so you gain passive income:

  • Fast Track Passive Income Plan

Frequently Asked Questions

Who can be your sponsor at eXp Realty?

Any active eXp agent who influenced your decision can be your sponsor. Find a sponsor team that has the time, systems, and a clear plan to provide value to you.

Who can be your co-sponsor and who can’t?

Your co-sponsor must be a single active eXp agent. They do not extend upline access. Pick someone with defined availability and local or niche value. If needed, you may request a change with a valid reason.

What happens if I don’t name a sponsor when I join?

You can join without one, but you lose a working upline and potential sponsor team value support. You cannot add a sponsor later unless you leave for twelve months and rejoin. Do the homework upfront and avoid a slow start.

Can I name a sponsor after submitting my application?

You must list your sponsor during onboarding. If there is a clear error, contact onboarding support before approval. After approval, a sponsor change requires a full twelve month reset.

What’s the difference between a sponsor and a co-sponsor?

Your sponsor is the primary influencer and gateway to an upline. Your co-sponsor is a single additional helper chosen after you join. Both can receive revenue share from the company dollar.

What happens if I name a sponsor incorrectly or change my mind?

If the name is wrong, fix it during onboarding. After approval, sponsor changes require a twelve month break and rejoin. Co-sponsor changes may be possible with cause. Document your issue and submit a request.

Why do some eXp Realty sponsors want to help you?

Sponsors and co-sponsors earn from the company dollar, not from your split. Helping you is smart business. You win with faster production and clearer systems. They win when you close deals and grow.
